Description: Bowl and stem sherd of Attic silhouette style pottery cup, probably a type A cup; interior: small reserved tondo with painted decoration consisting of whirligig of four frontal half-satyrs, in silhouette style, joined in a circle, two with right hand raised, others with both hands on hips, elbows akimbo; exterior: glazed black with added red band on fillet at top of stem; upper part of interior of stem reserved, black lower down.
Curator's comments: For the whirligig of protomes, see Acropolis 606 (Graef, B. and Langlotz, E., Die antiken Vasen von der Akropolis zu Athen. Berlin 1925-33, pl. 32). For the use of the silhouette style, see Agora XXIII, no. 1779, pl. 113 and no. 1833, pl. 118.
Bibliographic references: Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 272, no. 70)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0637) (Phase 1)
